title: Why are Slavs more Mongoloid genetically and phenotypically than Hungarians? - Quora

response.answer_text: The premise is incorrect: Slavs in the Central Plain of Russia or Central Europe do not have a substantial Mongol or Mongoloid trace, either phenotypically or genetically. The main difference between Southern and Northern European type, including Russians, is in the extent of Neolithic settlements of Anatolian farmers. Phenotype. This is the standard model look,   that cannot be told apart, for example, from Polish (may be a bit less pride?): https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&q=polish+models  and the Russian football team after a penalty:  As for Hungarians, they look differently than Balto-Slavs not because they are “less Mongoloid” , but because they genetically closer to Southern Slavs (see “Hu, purple open square”):  Why? Because Hungarians and Southern Slavs, as well as Spanish, Italians, and Greek have a large admixture from the ancient culture of Anatolian farmers that spread 7200 ybp, related to Minoans. In contrast, Western and Eastern Slavs are mostly native Western Hunter Gatherers and do not have much of the Anatolian admixture. The myth of Mongoloid component in Slavs, probably, originates from the fact that Mongols and their successors Tatars made Russia to pay tribute for 250 years. But do Russians have a male Mongol trace in their DNA? Look at the Y-chromosome haplotype map:  Here Mongol Y-haplotype C is shown by pink color. As you can see, C haplotype is spread in Mongolia, Kazachstan, among Buryats, Koryaks, Evenks, and, surprisingly, among native Australians and native New Zealanders and Oceania. According to this map, Maori are related to Mongols. Mongolian admixture of European Slavs in male lineage is a myth. If we look at European Russians below, we find mostly East Indo-European R1a, Paleolithic European I1a, I1b. For Russians living in the North, we also see North-Eurasian N. Poles have no N but have some West European R1b. No C is detectable in either group.  How is this possible? During Mongolian dominance until Ivan III, they took women from Russia to the Golden Horde, as a tax, and married them. No wonder Tatars are so European-looking and no noticeable trace of haplotype C is present in Russia: the gene flow from the West to the East. Genome-wide DNA studies confirm this assessment. Genome-wide study for haplotype N groups Russians with Eastern Balts. The Russians of Central plain (green diamonds) are close to Balts and far from Finns (blue and green on the right top). The North Finland is rich in haplotype N (green dashes). Helsinki population is more rich in Paleolithic I1a than N and, hence, closer to Europeans.  The origin of autosomal DNA is mostly Western-Hunter-Gatherers (blue):  Note orange color in Spain, Greece, Italy, and Hungary, but not in the North: this is Anatolian admixture of Levantine origin. Therefore, the main difference between Southern and Northern European type, including Russians is in the extent of Neolithic settlements of Anatolian farmers.
